column4: I don't know the answer to your problem, but I can help you look... start searching for "pmount user permissions"
can you tell me the output of the 'groups' command?
sure,but,where can i find that output?properties,permissions?
open accessories > terminal, then type 'groups' without quotes, and press enter
rgg adm dialout fax cdrom floppy tape audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner admin
yes, it is probably related, but notice that that was fixed back in warty.  Where does your device get mounted to?
media/usbdisk
ls -ld /media/usbdisk
done.let me try adding some file there
nah, that won't do anything.  just gives you info.  What did it say?
hahahah
drwx------ 4 rgg rgg 8192 1969-12-31 21:00 /media/usbdisk
interesting... that means you should be able to write to it.  What does 'touch /media/usbdisk/test' say?  (this creates an empty file called test)
touch: no  possvel realizar touch sobre `/media/usbdisk/test': Sistema de arquivos somente-leitura
translating...
it's ok I know portuguese :)
oh,ok
but, tath explains the problem
so,what is the problem?
search for "ubuntu pmount read-only" I'm reading through the threads now.  here is an interesting one https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/gnome-system-tools/+bug/26338
oops, wrong link.   I meant: https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+ticket/2252
interesting.so,the guy just had to format his mp3 player?
yeah, seems like it.  Though I'm not sure /why/
